p.s: Barack Obama gave a speech at the Culture and Arts Center of Mimar Sinan Fine Arts University in Tophane, Istanbul in 2009, in which he mentions the importance of bringing young people together from all over the world.
In the following text I will analyse the structure and the choice of words from Obama's speech.
In his speech he makes clear that he has seen everywhere he goes that young people who are passionate and deeply informed about the world around them.
That's why he wants to break down walls (l. 13) so young people can come together and speak to eachothereach other.
So first of all Barack Obama uses many stylistic devices to get the readersreaders' attention and to encourage his listeners.
He uses an anaphora three times.
In line four, he says I've seen it and also in line five and seven he speaks I saw it and I've seen it.
Because of that, he gets the readers or listeners focused on the importance he is talking about.
Also in line 18 he uses I want you to know that and in line 21 And I want you to know that.
Here he also gets the readersreaders' attention.
Furthermore, he speaks to the listeners by saying you can in line 18, 19 and 20.
He speaks directly to his listeners and gets so even more attention.
In these three lines he also makes clear that everyone of us can choose to put aside longstanding divisions and can choose to advance a prosperity.

By giving these examples, he even more gets the readersreaders' attention to do something and he gives the feeling that he's supporting you and that you can do it and that you can choose to do something.
He creates a community by giving these examples and by saying you.
In the end, he also mentions that everyone will find a partner and a supporter and a friend in the United States of America (line 21-22).
By giving all of these examples and stylistic devices he gets the listeners focused and gets their attention.
